content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Certainly! Here is a sample function `add_yearmonth` in Julia that achieves this:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df.ym = dateformat.(df.dt, "yyyymm")
    return df
end
```

You can call this function by passing your DataFrame `df` as an argument, and it will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame with the year and month concatenated together as an integer in the format "yyyymm".
